intro: Asarca aurantiaca, commonly known as the orange cress, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and can be found in meadows, streambanks, and woodland edges. Asarca aurantiaca is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
